about_the_game:
Your sister Clara needs your help. Their city architect disappeared without any sign and no one else in Glintland is better suited for this job than you.

Therefore, join her Dragonheart Academy, forge legendary items with your relaxing tile-based factory settlement and restore Glintland's glory after a mysterious darkness crossed the land.

In short play sessions, Glintland offers a tile-placing game with a simplified reduced world you can relax and immerse yourself in. Any free minute can be used to leave reality behind to take on a new fantasy challenge. Fulfill the needs of the people and use your gained experience to unlock new exciting tiles and ways to play.

Deck of Tiles

Each game begins with a randomly shuffled tile deck. Then draw tiles into your hand. Look at your open jobs and find a good spot to start with your first tile in the world. After you have placed your first tile, each further tile has to be placed on a valid connecting spot. Once your hand is empty, draw again up to your hand limit and continue tiling until your job is fulfilled and you are happy with your settlement or challenge yourself in Trials and Favours and keep playing until you are out of tiles.

Trouble-Free Place and Play

There is no need for micromanaging your placed tiles in Glintland.

  • With a Harvester in hand, place it on any Drakewood, Myrium or Redlon field, to harvest the precious resources from that field.

  • The workshop allows to further develop the gained resources into a higher class. Melt Redlon into Glass and crush it in another Workshop to Fairy Dust. Durable mechanical gears are shaped in Workshops when providing Myrium Plates.
    Whatever you feed into a Workshop will decide the output.

  • Assemblers will combine any resources into new enhanced items. Get ready to craft Forbidden Spell Books, Tangerian Harps, Magic Staffs, Disruptor Fields and many other powerful tools.

  • Even the Transportation Belts are omnidirectional until a connected building defines the direction. In Glintland there is no need to fiddle around just to get the direction of belts right.

Glintland can be approached in various scenarios. The Quick Game allows you to take just a couple of minutes to challenge yourself to bring all your tiles meaningful into construction. Or follow the path of the Story Mode and help the citizens of Glintland to uncover the secrets of a mysterious darkness which causes fear and terror. Or compete in the Tournament Mode with your friends by creating the same game conditions for everyone and discover who can create the most valuable settlement.

Glintland is developed by Kris F. Lynhart, a game dev veteran, who worked on Gears Tactics, Transformers, World of Tanks and now wants to bring his passion for board games, factory games, and short relaxing gaming sessions back on the table. He dedicates this game to his two kids, Leon and Kiara, who love to play Glintland. Because Kris' well-thought-out input design allows even children as young as 3 years old to play it.

The game is still in development and targeted to be released in Q4 2025.
We love to hear your thoughts, opinions and feedback of all kinds. There are planned Betas and Demos coming up during 2025, so stay tuned.

Music: Danilo Kapel

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit version 1909 revision .1350 or higher, or versions 2004 and 20H2 revision .789 or higher
  • Processor: Quad-core Intel or AMD, 2.5 GHz or faster
  • Graphics: 8 GB RAM
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1 GB available space

  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
